title: Mitigating Bias Effects
content: Bias mitigation requires structured processes that don't rely on unbiased thinking: checklists, devil's advocacy, pre-mortems, diverse perspectives, and decision frameworks. We can't think our way out of biases—we must build systems that compensate for them.

mcq.question: What's the most effective approach to reducing bias in team decisions?

options.A: Train people to recognize their biases
options.B: Use structured processes and diverse perspectives that don't depend on unbiased individuals
options.C: Rely on the most experienced person
options.D: Make decisions quickly before bias affects them

mcq.explanation: Awareness helps but isn't sufficient—biases persist despite awareness. Structured processes (checklists, frameworks), diverse perspectives, and explicit challenge requirements create systematic bias resistance that doesn't depend on individual cognition.

openQuestions: What structured processes does your team use to counter biases?
How do you ensure diverse perspectives inform important decisions?
